Sequence Information.Peptide Name: pEM-2 (Derived from the venom of the snake Bothrops asper)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.27591703] Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus isolates(MIC=5.3 ± 2.3 mg/L, MBC=6.7 ± 2.3 mg/L), Enterococcus faecalis isolates(MIC=6.7 ± 2.3 mg/L, MBC=8.0 ± 0.0 mg/L);Gram-negative bacteria :Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates(MIC=4.0 ± 3.5 mg/L, MBC=4.0 ± 3.5 mg/L), Acinetobacter baumannii isolates(MIC=4.0 ± 0.0 mg/L, MBC=5.3 ± 2.3 mg/L)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.27591703] 0% hemolysis at 2 μg/ml , 5% hemolysis at 4 μg/ml , 15% hemolysis at 8 μg/ml , 55% hemolysis at 16 μg/ml , 87% hemolysis at 32 μg/ml , 92% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against human red blood cells; 0% hemolysis at 16 μg/ml , 2.5% hemolysis at 32 μg/ml , 10% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against sheep red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.27591703] The cell viability of HEK293 cells induced by PV is 99.1%, 99.1%, 98.3%, 94.8%, 93.9%, 87.5% and 84.1% at peptide concentrations of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64 μg/mL within 24h.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria

Literature.Title: Design and characterization of short hybrid antimicrobial peptides from pEM-2, mastoparan-VT1, and mastoparan-B.
Literature.Reference: Chem Biol Drug Des. 2017 Mar;89(3)327-338. doi 10.1111/cbdd.12864.
Literature.Author: Memariani H, Shahbazzadeh D, Ranjbar R, Behdani M, Memariani M, Pooshang Bagheri K

Literature.Title: Rational Evolution of Antimicrobial Peptides Containing Unnatural Amino Acids to Combat Burn Wound Infections
Literature.Author: Xiong M, Chen M, Zhang J

Literature.Title: Bactericidal and antiendotoxic properties of short cationic peptides derived from a snake venom Lys49 phospholipase A2
Literature.Author: Santamaria C, Larios S, Quiros S, Pizarro-Cerda J, Gorvel JP, Lomonte B, Moreno E
